content.description:
Probably one of the least inspiring problems in Little. But golly, it's one proud horse.

Start matched on a poor sloper/crimp, grabbing it in a way that won't slice your finger on the small spike. Pay the toll. Right foot on the shank and make a hard move to a rad sloper crimp up and left, then pop over right to a jug and mantle. Fresh skin and clouds make this a headcheese dream.

Fairly desperate. Grainy. Round. Huxtable Pogey would be proud!
content.location: Right off the main trail. Walk north from All Thumbs, crossing the main trail and you'll see the grainy boulder right in front of you.

content.description:
From the Black Bible: “The crazy vertical crystal vein running up the tall face. The hardest moves are off the deck.”

I started with left hand on a small obvious pinch chest height, and a Gaston crimp for the right.

Small sharp crystal holds. Top is easy but loose. Very tall, a slip near the end would be unfortunate.

Great view from the top.
content.location: Straight up hill maybe 50 yds from west side of Tiger Stripe boulder
